src.analysis.core.figure_1_data module¶

Data loading and aggregation helpers for Figure 1.

src.analysis.core.figure_1_data.bootstrap_problem_ratio(problem_step_df: DataFrame, column: str, num_bootstrap: int = 1000, seed: int = 0) → DataFrame[source]¶

Aggregate per-step accuracy ratios with optional bootstrap CIs.

src.analysis.core.figure_1_data.build_positive_delta_flags(problem_step_df: DataFrame) → Dict[str, Dict[int, bool]][source]¶

Return green-dot flags keyed by domain and step.

src.analysis.core.figure_1_data.build_problem_step(data_frame: DataFrame) → DataFrame[source]¶

Aggregate correctness and Aha flags at the (problem, step) level.

src.analysis.core.figure_1_data.coerce_bool(value: Any) → int | None[source]¶

Best-effort conversion to {0,1}.

Returns:

1/0 for recognized truthy/falsey values, or None if there is no reasonable interpretation (e.g., complex structures).

src.analysis.core.figure_1_data.fit_trend_wls(ratio_df: DataFrame) → Tuple[float, float, float, float, float, ndarray, ndarray][source]¶

Fit a weighted least-squares trend line for per-step ratios.

src.analysis.core.figure_1_data.load_pass1_samples_multi(files_by_domain: Dict[str, List[str]], gpt_keys: List[str], gpt_subset_native: bool) → DataFrame[source]¶

Load pass-1 records for multiple domains.

src.analysis.core.figure_1_data.mark_formal_pairs(problem_step_df: DataFrame, delta1: float = 0.2, delta2: float = 0.2, min_prior_steps: int = 2, delta3: float | None = None) → DataFrame[source]¶

Mark rows that satisfy the Formal Aha definition.

src.analysis.core.figure_1_data.nat_step_from_path(path: str) → int | None[source]¶

Try to infer an integer training step from a path or filename.

Uses a collection of regexes that cover the various conventions used in analysis scripts (step123, global_step-123, checkpoint_123, …).

src.analysis.core.figure_1_data.parse_float_list(value: str) → List[float][source]¶

Parse a comma-separated string into floats.

src.analysis.core.figure_1_data.scan_files(root: str, split_substr: str | None) → List[str][source]¶

Collect JSONL files under root optionally filtered by split_substr.

src.analysis.core.figure_1_data.slugify(text: str) → str[source]¶

Convert an arbitrary string into a filesystem-friendly slug.

src.analysis.core.figure_1_helpers.bootstrap_problem_ratio(problem_step_df: DataFrame, col: str, num_bootstrap_samples: int = 1000, seed: int = 0) → DataFrame[source]¶

Compute bootstrapped per-step ratios for a boolean column.

src.analysis.core.figure_1_helpers.build_formal_thresholds_from_args(delta1: float, delta2: float, min_prior_steps: int, delta3: float | None) → FormalThresholds[source]¶

Shared wrapper to construct FormalThresholds from raw args.

src.analysis.core.figure_1_helpers.build_positive_delta_flags(problem_step_df: DataFrame) → Dict[str, Dict[int, bool]][source]¶

Return per-domain/step flags indicating whether formal shifts show positive gain.

True means the mean gain-at-shift exceeds 0.12 among rows with aha_any_gpt==1.

src.analysis.core.figure_1_helpers.export_formal_aha_json_with_text(problem_step_df: DataFrame, files_by_domain: Dict[str, List[str]], config: FormalAhaExportConfig) → Tuple[str, str, int][source]¶

Export the formal AHA events alongside truncated answer text.

src.analysis.core.figure_1_helpers.make_formal_thresholds(delta1: float, delta2: float, min_prior_steps: int, delta3: float | None) → FormalThresholds[source]¶

Convenience constructor for FormalThresholds used by multiple scripts.

src.analysis.core.figure_1_helpers.mark_formal_pairs(problem_step_df: DataFrame, delta1: float = 0.2, delta2: float = 0.2, min_prior_steps: int = 2, delta3: float | None = None) → DataFrame[source]¶

Return a copy of problem_step_df annotated with formal AHA flags.

src.analysis.core.figure_2_plotting_base module¶

Backwards-compat wrapper re-exporting Figure 2 plotting helpers under src.analysis.core for older import paths used in tests.

Attach a lower-centered legend shared across several Figure 2 plots.

Persist figure as PNG/PDF using the metadata in config.

src.analysis.core.h2_uncertainty_helpers module¶

Shared helpers for the H2 uncertainty bucket + histogram views.

src.analysis.core.h2_uncertainty_helpers.get_aha_gpt_flag(pass1_dict: Dict[str, Any] | None, record: Dict[str, Any] | None) → int | None[source]¶

Return the first truthy GPT/LLM shift flag available on pass1 or root.

src.analysis.core.h2_uncertainty_helpers.label_formal_samples(samples_df: DataFrame, formal_step_df: DataFrame) → DataFrame[source]¶

Sample-level Formal=1 when (problem, step) is formal_pair and GPT shift == 1.

src.analysis.core.h2_uncertainty_helpers.load_all_defs_for_buckets(files: List[str], unc_field: str, gate_gpt_by_words: bool) → DataFrame[source]¶

Load all samples needed for the uncertainty buckets and histogram views.

Returns a DataFrame with problem, step, correctness, uncertainty, and both GPT and words-based Aha labels.

src.analysis.core.h2_uncertainty_helpers.make_all3_uncertainty_buckets_figure(files: List[str], out_dir: str, args: Namespace) → tuple[str, str, DataFrame, DataFrame][source]¶

Build the three-way uncertainty buckets figure and associated CSV tables.

Returns the figure path, CSV path, the annotated sample DataFrame, and the problem-step table used for Formal Aha definitions.

src.analysis.core.h2_uncertainty_helpers.mark_formal_pairs(problem_step_df: DataFrame, thresholds: FormalThresholds) → DataFrame¶

Mark (problem, step) pairs that satisfy the Formal Aha definition with a gain-at-shift threshold.

Expects the columns listed in FORMAL_REQUIRED_COLUMNS and returns a copy of the input with an aha_formal_pair indicator column.

src.analysis.core.h2_uncertainty_helpers.plot_uncertainty_buckets_three(d_words: DataFrame, d_gpt: DataFrame, d_formal: DataFrame, out_path: str, title_suffix: str = '') → None[source]¶

Plot three-panel uncertainty buckets figure for Words, GPT, and Formal Aha.

src.analysis.core.h2_uncertainty_helpers.plot_uncertainty_hist_100bins(d_all: DataFrame, problem_step_df: DataFrame, out_dir: str, args: Namespace) → tuple[str, str][source]¶

Histogram of uncertainty_std with total counts and Aha COUNTS per bin (Words, GPT, Formal). Writes a PNG/PDF and a CSV with bin stats.

src.analysis.core.h2_uncertainty_helpers.style_ame_axis(axis) → None[source]¶

Apply consistent styling to AME plots.

src.analysis.core.plotting_helpers module¶

Shared plotting/CLI helpers used across figure scripts.

src.analysis.core.plotting_helpers.aha_histogram_legend_handles(axis_right: Axes) → Sequence[Line2D | Patch][source]¶

Build legend handles for the uncertainty histogram + Aha counts figure.

src.analysis.core.plotting_helpers.compute_effective_max_step(args: Namespace, hard_max_step: int) → int[source]¶

Shared helper for enforcing a hard cap on max_step in CLI scripts.

src.analysis.core.plotting_helpers.create_a4_figure(orientation: str = 'portrait', dpi: int = 300) → Figure[source]¶

Create a Matplotlib figure sized to an A4 page in inches.

src.analysis.core.plotting_helpers.set_global_fonts(font_family: str = 'Times New Roman', font_size: int = 12) → None[source]¶

Apply the default paper font style (Times, 12pt) for all figure elements.

Module contents¶

Core helpers and module re-exports for RQ1–RQ3 analyses.

src.analysis.core.add_formal_flags_column(frame: DataFrame, group_keys: List[str] | None = None, *, config: FormalFlagConfig | None = None, **legacy_thresholds: Any) → DataFrame[source]¶

Add a per-row Formal Aha flag column grouped by group_keys.

The input frame must contain step, freq_correct, aha_rate_gpt and aha_any_gpt columns. The returned DataFrame is a sorted copy of frame with an added integer out_column.

src.analysis.core.aha_series_for_group(sub: DataFrame) → Tuple[ndarray, ndarray, ndarray][source]¶

Extract sorted series used in formal-aha scans.

Returns freq_correct, aha_rate_gpt, aha_any_gpt arrays sorted by step.

src.analysis.core.build_formal_thresholds_from_args(delta1: float, delta2: float, min_prior_steps: int, delta3: float | None) → FormalThresholds[source]¶

Shared wrapper to construct FormalThresholds from raw args.

src.analysis.core.build_problem_step_for_formal(d_samples: DataFrame) → DataFrame[source]¶

Convenience wrapper for Formal Aha analyses.

Aggregates sample-level rows to per-(problem, step) summaries and also includes native Aha statistics, treating aha_words as the native column.

src.analysis.core.build_problem_step_from_samples(samples_df: DataFrame, include_native: bool = False, native_col: str = 'aha_native') → DataFrame[source]¶

Aggregate sample-level rows to per-(problem, step) summaries.

When include_native is True, native aha columns are aggregated as well.

src.analysis.core.compute_correct_and_shift(domain: str, pass1_data: Dict[str, Any], record: Dict[str, Any], *, config: LoadRowsConfig | None = None, **legacy_gating: Any) → Tuple[int, int] | None[source]¶

Compute (correct, shift) flags for a single PASS-1-style sample.

The carpark_success_fn is only used for Carpark-style domains. Returns None if correctness cannot be determined.

src.analysis.core.compute_formal_flags_for_group(sub: DataFrame, thresholds: FormalThresholds, formal_prior_ok_fn: Callable[[ndarray, ndarray, int, FormalThresholds], bool]) → ndarray[source]¶

Compute formal-aha flags for a grouped problem-step slice.

The returned array has length len(sub) and uses the provided formal_prior_ok_fn() together with aha_series_for_group().

src.analysis.core.discover_roots_by_temp(scan_root: str, temps: List[float], low_alias: float, skip_substrings: set) → Dict[float, Dict[str, str]][source]¶

Shared directory discovery used by temperature_effects and temp_graph.

Walks scan_root and discovers per-temperature roots by domain, using parse_temp_from_dir() and simple heuristics to classify domains.

src.analysis.core.discover_roots_for_temp_args(args: Namespace, skip_set: set, include_math3: bool) → Dict[float, Dict[str, str]][source]¶

Shared helper used by temperature_effects and temp_graph to construct the mapping {temp -> domain -> root_dir} from CLI arguments.

src.analysis.core.iter_pass1_records(files: Iterable[str]) → Iterable[Tuple[str, int | None, Dict[str, object]]][source]¶

Yield (path, step_from_name, rec) tuples for PASS-1-style JSONL logs.

This mirrors the common pattern of scanning files, inferring step from the filename, and iterating JSONL records.
